body:
Can you try without the leading / in front of :http:/file1.txt ?

That commit is by @nielash - thoughts?
Leading `/` in file path, nor trailing slash in the remote's `url` has no effect.

So far, I have identified the reason is that in `NewFsFile`, the call to `cache.Get(ctx, remote)` now provides incorrect result. This makes the `NewFsFile` return empty string as a file name, which causes the difference between copy-file and sync-directory behaviors (https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/cmd/sync/sync.go#L242).

Debug statement I've added
```
	f, err := cache.Get(ctx, remote)
	fs.Debugf(nil, "NewFsFile - cache.Get: remote=%q f=%v err=%v" , remote, f, err)
```

#### Debug message without any options

```
DEBUG: NewFsFile - cache.Get: remote="local9:file1.txt" f=http://localhost:9999/ err=<nil>
```

#### Debug message  with `--http-no-head` option (provides the same results as `--http-url ...`)

```
DEBUG: NewFsFile - cache.Get: remote="local9:file1.txt" f=http://localhost:9999/ err=is a file not a directory
```

That just confirms that it's somehow related to cache. Don't understand how yet.
What bugs me is that `f=http://localhost:9999/` and not `f=http://localhost:9999/file1.txt` (but I'm not sure whether it's even related).

---

Update: Okay, found out what the issue is and why. But I have no idea how the cache is supposed to work, so I'm not sure what the correct fix should be.

What causes different behavior between no command line options and having some command line overrides (e.g. `--http-no-head`) is the added suffix when override is detected.

> DEBUG : http_sync: detected overridden config - adding "{NBTUO}" suffix to name
> DEBUG : fs cache: renaming child cache item "http_sync:file1.txt" to be canonical for parent "http_sync{NBTUO}:file1.txt"

That affects the `canonicalName != canonicalFsString` condition: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41/fs/cache/cache.go#L117

Which then calls `addChild`: https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41/fs/cache/cache.go#L135

And finally the difference shows as result of `getError(fsString, err)`:
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41/fs/cache/cache.go#L139

That's because the `getError` treats `ErrorIsFile` somehow specially and if the file is not found by `isChild` (it won't because `addChild` was never called on it), the error is dropped.
https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41/fs/cache/cache.go#L85-L93

---

After looking at the code even more, I think following patch should do it.

```diff
diff --git a/fs/cache/cache.go b/fs/cache/cache.go
index 0ab2492ce..1764d31d1 100644
--- a/fs/cache/cache.go
+++ b/fs/cache/cache.go
@@ -83,13 +83,10 @@ func isChild(child string) bool {
 
 // ensures that we return fs.ErrorIsFile when necessary
 func getError(fsString string, err error) error {
-	if err != nil && err != fs.ErrorIsFile {
-		return err
-	}
-	if isChild(fsString) {
+	if err == nil && isChild(fsString) {
 		return fs.ErrorIsFile
 	}
-	return nil
+	return err
 }
 
 // GetFn gets an fs.Fs named fsString either from the cache or creates
```

`getError` is only called in scope of `GetFn` and at that point, all errors except `ErrorIsFile` are already handled and returned early by https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/2a1e28f5f5683eaba22d67a0e253c95b934f8c41/fs/cache/cache.go#L108-L113

But at that point, it would be probably better to just get rid of `getError` and inline the error handling logic.
I think the root cause (no pun intended) might be this: https://github.com/nielash/rclone/commit/7dd1259ec967f5dc4a26d2de8dabc116c321d69c

> Given `sync`/`copy` command with specific source filename `1.68.2` used to sync only the single specified file. In `1.69.0` however, it copies entire file's directory instead (or nothing if HTTP server doesn't allow file listing).

Also, as a tangential aside, this behavior is somewhat undocumented... and arguably even contrary to what is [documented](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_copy/#synopsis):
> To copy single files, use the [copyto](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_copyto/) command instead.

> Also, as a tangential aside, this behavior is somewhat undocumented... and arguably even contrary to what is [documented](https://rclone.org/commands/rclone_copy/#synopsis):

Regardless the documentation, the same behavior was observable with both `copy` and `copyto` commands.

Anyway, I tried your fix and it does seem to work.

issue.title: http: correct root if definitely pointing to a file - fixes #8428

repository.name: rclone
repository.description: "rsync for cloud storage" - Google Drive, S3, Dropbox, Backblaze B2, One Drive, Swift, Hubic, Wasabi, Google Cloud Storage, Azure Blob, Azure Files, Yandex Files

issue.body:
#### What is the purpose of this change?

Fixes #8428 by ensuring that `http` returns the correct root when pointing to a file (as opposed to a dir).

This was formalized in https://github.com/rclone/rclone/commit/c69eb84573c85206ab028eda2987180e049ef2e4 But it appears that we forgot to update `http`, and the `FsRoot` test didn't catch it because we don't currently have an `http` integration test.

#### Was the change discussed in an issue or in the forum before?

- #8428

#### Checklist

- [x] I have read the [contribution guidelines](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-new-feature-or-bug-fix).
- [x] I have added tests for all changes in this PR if appropriate.
- [x] I have added documentation for the changes if appropriate.
- [x] All commit messages are in [house style](https://github.com/rclone/rclone/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#commit-messages).
- [x] I'm done, this Pull Request is ready for review :-)

body:
The program works correctly in the Windows environment, but the same bug occurs in the MacOS environment.  
Below are the results of running the `rclone --version` command on each platform.  

### Windows  
```
rclone v1.69.0           
- os/version: Microsoft Windows 10 Pro 22H2 22H2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 10.0.19045.5131 (x86_64)
- os/type: windows
- os/arch: amd64
- go/version: go1.23.4
- go/linking: static
- go/tags: cmount
```

### MacOS  
```
rclone v1.69.0
- os/version: darwin 15.3.2 (64 bit)
- os/kernel: 24.3.0 (arm64)
- os/type: darwin
- os/arch: arm64 (ARMv8 compatible)
- go/version: go1.23.4
- go/linking: dynamic
- go/tags: cmount
```
I've merged @nielash  fix for this to master now which means it will be in [the latest beta](https://beta.rclone.org/) in 15-30 minutes and released in v1.70
